results.title: Textiles and ornamental arts of India
results.creator_credit: Charles Eames, Ray Eames, Eames and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Displays the variety, sophistication, and beauty of India’s textiles and ornamental arts in a unique filmic interpretation of a exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. Captures the flavour of Indian traditions and philosophy, and explores the spiritual significance of art in the everyday life of the Indian people.

results.title: Textiles
results.creator_credit: John C. Elder and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the Scottish textile industry, showing the relation between the centres of the various industries and the resources of raw materials and driving-power for the mills. The process of manufacture of tweeds, linen, sailcloth from jute, and cotton and silk thread are shown in detail.

results.title: Texas: Instant Cities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture, the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate and introduces younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Part Nine deals with Texas, which issues more building permissions each year than any other State. Houston and Dallas have consequently become the most exciting cities in which to look at architecture. These “pop-up” cities are like a blackboard on which the problems of modern architecture are being chalked up. They show the 21st Century in the making - a prospect that is intriguing, daring and deeply disturbing.

results.title: Testing intelligence with the Stanford-Binet
results.brief_description: Records the actions of four children to selected items from the Stanford-Binet intelligence test. Explains the meaning of mental age and the calculation of the intelligence quotient.

results.title: Testing hypotheses
results.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of Science”
Scientific hypotheses don’t gain much respect until they have been tested. Some can be tested experimentally, others only through the weight of evidence. Pasteur’s classic experiments relating to spontaneous generation illustrate the former and the mass of evidence supporting theories of evolution illustrate the latter. For primary grades.

results.title: Testimony: a story machine
results.brief_description:
“Testimony: A Story Machine” is an interactive comic strip. It is a story to be played with. The user may click where s/he pleases, causing images to be replaced, or characters to animate and change position. By changing one image in a sequence of (say) four frames, the story implied by the sequence of four is altered, even when the other three frames remain static. The ideas for the project came from my previous experiments with cut-up collages of text and cut-up collages of comics, and also my interest in film and shot sequence and comics and frame sequence.
While the user plays with the interactive, sometimes the story will change, sometimes it will advance to a new setting. The library of images, animation, text and sound is composed of broadly similar narrative themes, but it is the sequence which determines the story. There is no end. There are no rules for interpreting the story. The user cannot do anything wrong and how the user interprets what they find is up to them. It is a work of non-linear fiction. As author, I provide the ingredients, the computer provides the sequencing and the reader provides the meaning or interpretation.

results.title: Testify
results.brief_description: ‘Testify’ is a song by American rock band Rage Against the Machine and the third single from their third album The Battle of Los Angeles.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description:
‘Testify’ is a song by American rock band Rage Against the Machine and the third single from their third album The Battle of Los Angeles.

The cover of the single was taken from the 1968 Olympics Black Power Salute. The song’s lyrics notably make reference to George Orwell’s novel 1984 through use of “The Party” slogan “Who controls the past (now), controls the future. Who controls the present (now), controls the past.”
description_for_label:

results.title: Testament: The Bible and history
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Ron Johnston, Antelope Films and Channel 4
results.brief_description: John Romer, an emminent archaelogist, undertakes a personal quest to examine the history of the Bible. He explores its origins and evolution through time as a rare and valuable sacred text, to a modern day paperback best seller available to the masses. Romer does not set out to discredit or disprove the literal truth of the Bible, but to examine how this influential text has shaped the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mischa Scorer, Ron Johnston, Antelope Films and Channel 4
